definition: a violent gust of wind
the effect or accompaniment (such as sleet) of such a gust
the sound produced by an impulsion of air through a wind instrument or whistle
examples: the blast of the shofar on Rosh Hashanah

definition: something resembling a gust of wind: such as
a stream of air or gas forced through a hole
a vehement expression of feeling
examples: … let out a great blast of mirth …

definition: the continuous blowing to which a charge of ore or metal is subjected in a blast furnace
a sudden pernicious influence or effect
examples: got a blast of reality when she left home
… virtue preserved from fell destruction's blast …

definition: a disease of plants marked by the formation of destructive lesions on leaves and inflorescences
an explosion or violent detonation
the shock wave of an explosion
examples: felt the blast from several miles away

definition: a forceful hit (as in baseball) or shot (as in soccer or golf), home run
speed, capacity, operation
examples: turned the water on full blast

definition: an enjoyably exciting experience, occasion, or event, party
the sending of a message (such as a fax or an email) in multiple copies to numerous recipients at one time
examples: The campaign then sends Jane targeted messages via canvassers, phone calls, ads, and its increasingly sophisticated email blasts.

definition: a striking reminder of an earlier time : something that excites nostalgia
examples: This picture is a real blast from the past.

definition: blare
to make a vigorous attack
to use an explosive
shoot
examples: They walked in and started blasting.

definition: to hit a golf ball out of a sand trap with explosive force
to proceed rapidly or aggressively
to injure by or as if by the action of wind
examples: young crops being blasted by the hot dry wind

definition: blight
examples: The entire crop was blasted by fungus.
The injury blasted her dreams of winning a gold medal.

definition: to shatter by or as if by an explosive
examples: blasting out nearly all of the building's windows

definition: to remove, open, or form by or as if by an explosive
examples: blast a hole through the wall
… blast away these barriers to progress …

definition: shoot
to attack vigorously
examples: blasting their opponents in the media

definition: to cause to blast off
examples: will blast themselves from the moon's surface

definition: to hit vigorously and effectively
to play loudly
examples: blasting rock music on the stereo

definition: bud : budding : germ
formative unit especially of living matter : germ : cell : cell layer
